Package io.artframework

Interface FinderProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Provider, Scoped
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultFinderProvider
    public interface FinderProvider
extends Provider
    Provides the option to register various finder implementations that can load different parts of the art-framework.

    Implement the AbstractFinder and FinderResult interface to create your own finders and then register them with this provider.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        static FinderProvider of​(Scope scope)
        Creates a new default finder provider with the given configuration.
        Parameters:
        scope - the scope of the provider
        Returns:
        the default finder provider

      • add

        FinderProvider add​(Finder finder)
        Adds the given finder to this finder provider if it does not exist.

        This means that the finder will be called on all @{code findAllIn(...)} methods in this provider.

        Nothing will happen if the finder instance has already been added to this provider.

        Parameters:
        finder - the finder to register
        Returns:
        this finder provider

      • remove

        FinderProvider remove​(Finder finder)
        Adds the given finder from this provider if it exists.

        Nothing will happen if the finder instance has not been added to this provider.

        Parameters:
        finder - the finder to remove
        Returns:
        this finder provider

      • clear

        FinderProvider clear()
        Removes all finders from this provider.
        Returns:
        this provider

      • all

        java.util.Collection<Finder> all()
        Returns:
        all finders that are currently registered in this provider

      • findAllIn

        default java.util.Collection<FinderResult<?>> findAllIn​(java.io.File file)
        Aggregates the find results of all finders registered in this provider.

        This will call the Finder.findAllIn(ClassLoader, File) method on all registered finders and return all results.

        Parameters:
        file - the jar file or sources root to search for classes
        Returns:
        a list of all finder results. this is never null but may be empty.

      • findAllIn

        default java.util.Collection<FinderResult<?>> findAllIn​(java.io.File file,
                                                        java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Class<?>> predicate)
        Aggregates the find results of all finders registered in this provider.

        Use the predicate to filter the loaded classes before returning them.

        This will call the Finder.findAllIn(ClassLoader, File) method on all registered finders and return all results.

        Parameters:
        file - the jar file or sources root to search for classes
        predicate - the predicate to filter the loaded classes on
        Returns:
        a list of all finder results. this is never null but may be empty.

      • findAllIn

        default java.util.Collection<FinderResult<?>> findAllIn​(java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader,
                                                        java.io.File file,
                                                        java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Class<?>> predicate)
        Aggregates the find results of all finders registered in this provider.

        The provided class loader is used to load the found classes.

        Use the predicate to filter the loaded classes before returning them.

        This will call the Finder.findAllIn(ClassLoader, File) method on all registered finders and return all results.

        Parameters:
        file - the jar file or sources root to search for classes
        predicate - the predicate to filter the loaded classes on
        classLoader - the classloader used to load the classes inside the file
        Returns:
        a list of all finder results. this is never null but may be empty.

      • findAllAndLoadIn

        default java.util.Collection<FinderResult<?>> findAllAndLoadIn​(java.io.File file)
        Aggregates the find results of all finders registered in this provider and calls the load method on all results.

        This will call the Finder.findAllIn(ClassLoader, File) method on all registered finders and then call FinderResult.load(Scope) on all of them returning the result.

        Parameters:
        file - the jar file or sources root to search for classes
        Returns:
        a list of all finder results. this is never null but may be empty.

      • findAllAndLoadIn

        default java.util.Collection<FinderResult<?>> findAllAndLoadIn​(java.io.File file,
                                                               java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Class<?>> predicate)
        Aggregates the find results of all finders registered in this provider and calls the load method on all results.

        The loaded classes can be filtered using the predicate before the load method is called on them.

        This will call the Finder.findAllIn(ClassLoader, File) method on all registered finders and then call FinderResult.load(Scope) on all of them returning the result.

        Parameters:
        file - the jar file or sources root to search for classes
        predicate - the predicate to filter the loaded classes on
        Returns:
        a list of all finder results. this is never null but may be empty.

      • findAllAndLoadIn

        default java.util.Collection<FinderResult<?>> findAllAndLoadIn​(java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader,
                                                               java.io.File file,
                                                               java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Class<?>> predicate)
        Aggregates the find results of all finders registered in this provider and calls the load method on all results.

        The provided classloader is used to load the classes inside the file.

        The loaded classes can be filtered using the predicate before the load method is called on them.

        This will call the Finder.findAllIn(ClassLoader, File) method on all registered finders and then call FinderResult.load(Scope) on all of them returning the result.

        Parameters:
        classLoader - the classloader used to load the classes from the file
        file - the jar file or sources root to search for classes
        predicate - the predicate to filter the loaded classes on
        Returns:
        a list of all finder results. this is never null but may be empty.
